intro: Dicliptera clinopodia, commonly known as narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, two-lipped flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
